conversation.message: Hello Company_C—I'm Seeker_E and I’m very interested in joining your team. conversation.message: Thank you for applying, Seeker_E. We appreciate your interest in Company_C and the strengths you highlighted. At this time, we’re going to move forward with other candidates whose profiles are a closer fit for our current hiring priorities. We wish you the best in your search.
conversation.thought: Seeker_E is on our true priority list but ranked 4th (behind Seeker_B, Seeker_C, Seeker_D). In round 1 we have quota 1 and only Seeker_E applied to us. However, Seeker_B (our #1) ranks Company_C 3rd and will likely apply to Company_A then Company_B first; Seeker_C ranks Company_C 2nd and may come to us after trying Company_B; Seeker_D ranks Company_C 2nd and may also come after trying Company_B. Since accepting Seeker_E now would fill our only slot and prevent hiring higher-priority seekers who may approach in subsequent rounds, it is optimal to reject now and keep capacity for higher-ranked candidates. Risk: we may end up unmatched if none apply later, but given multiple seekers have Company_C as 2nd/3rd choice, the chance of receiving better applicants in later rounds is reasonable.
